ProjectTitle: Validating the application of a first-in-class human serum-functional immunodynamic status (sFIS) assay as bona fide immuno-oncology biomarker
InitialFeedbackHistory:
20/05/2022
3. Personal data: You write not applicable, however, in the description of your data it is mentioned that patient data will be processed. Please note that even if the direct identifiers have been removed, these might still be personal data. Please have a look at https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/researchers#section-8 for the difference between pseudonymized and anonymized data. All processing of personal data at KU Leuven needs to undergo a privacy review. More information on this procedure can be found at https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/index
3. Ethics: The DMP provides a list of ethics approval numbers, with some of these rather old. Are these approvals still valid? Furthermore, do these approvals also cover the secondary use of the patient samples/data? Please ensure that your all your work is covered by a valid ethics protocol, see: www.kuleuven.be/english/research/ethics/committees
 6. Please note that data that is part of a clinical trail should be preserved for 25 years; the UZL ethics committee recommends 25 years preservation of all data related an ethics protocol. 
7. KU Leuven now also has a data repository (RDR) that you can use for data sharing, here you can share data openly or apply access restrictions, see www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr. For omics data you can consider using repositories from EBI: www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/
